actor_awards.notes: Nominated for Best Actor for 'Mutiny on the Bounty' (1935). Known for his sophisticated demeanor, he was a key figure in 1930s cinema and often co-starred with his then-wife Joan Crawford.

filmography.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
filmography.role_description: An idealistic midshipman who is torn between his loyalty to the captain and his friendship with the mutineers.
filmography.plot: A tyrannical ship captain drives his crew to mutiny during a voyage to Tahiti.

filmography.title: The Lives of a Bengal Lancer
filmography.role_description: A cynical, fun-loving officer in the 41st Bengal Lancers stationed on the Northwest Frontier of India.
filmography.plot: British officers stationed in India fight to protect the frontier against a rebellious local ruler.

filmography.title: Five Graves to Cairo
filmography.role_description: A British soldier stranded in a hotel in the Sahara who assumes a false identity to spy on Field Marshal Rommel.
filmography.plot: A British corporal finds himself the only person standing between Rommel's Afrika Korps and the Suez Canal.

filmography.title: Three Comrades
filmography.role_description: One of three German WWI veterans trying to survive and maintain their friendship in the chaotic post-war years.
filmography.plot: Three friends share their love for a dying woman against the backdrop of political unrest in 1920s Germany.

filmography.title: Dangerous
filmography.role_description: A successful architect who risks his career and engagement to rehabilitate a washed-up alcoholic actress.
filmography.plot: An alcoholic actress is rehabilitated by a prominent architect who falls in love with her, unaware that she is 'jinxed'.

filmography.title: Phantom Lady
filmography.role_description: A sculptor and friend of the protagonist who is revealed to have a dark connection to the murder.
filmography.plot: A secretary tries to find the mysterious woman who can provide an alibi for her boss, who is accused of murdering his wife.

filmography.title: Advise & Consent
filmography.role_description: The dying President of the United States who is determined to push through a controversial Secretary of State nomination.
filmography.plot: A controversy swirls around the President's nominee for Secretary of State, leading to blackmail and political maneuvering in the Senate.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or (Film)

filmography.title: Bombshell
filmography.role_description: A wealthy Bostonian who romances a Hollywood starlet, not realizing the chaos of her life.
filmography.plot: A screwball comedy about a Hollywood starlet trying to escape the madness of her life, her studio, and her family.

filmography.title: Dancing Lady
filmography.role_description: A wealthy playboy who backs a show to win the heart of a dancer, hoping she will quit the stage.
filmography.plot: A burlesque dancer is bailed out of jail by a rich playboy who gets her a start on Broadway, but he has ulterior motives.

filmography.title: Quality Street
filmography.role_description: A dashing doctor who unknowingly falls in love with his old friend when she poses as her own niece.
filmography.plot: A woman disguises herself as her own niece to win back the affections of the man she loves.

filmography.title: A Yank at Oxford
filmography.role_description: A British student at Oxford who rivals the American newcomer in athletics and romance.
filmography.plot: A cocky American track athlete gets a scholarship to Oxford University, where he clashes with British customs and students.

filmography.title: Dark Waters
filmography.role_description: A local doctor who helps a traumatized woman discover a plot against her.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman recovering from a shipwreck goes to stay with her aunt and uncle on a plantation, but strange events make her fear for her sanity.

filmography.title: The Gorgeous Hussy
filmography.role_description: The Secretary of War who becomes involved with the spirited Peggy O'Neal.
filmography.plot: The story of Peggy O'Neal, the daughter of an innkeeper who charms President Andrew Jackson and disrupts Washington society.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Beulah Bondi)

filmography.title: Midnight Mary
filmography.role_description: A wealthy lawyer who falls in love with a woman on trial for murder.
filmography.plot: A woman on trial for murder recounts her life of poverty and crime, and her romance with a man from a different world.

filmography.title: The Girl from Missouri
filmography.role_description: The son of a millionaire who becomes the target of a gold-digger's affections, only to fall in love with her.
filmography.plot: A young woman moves to New York City determined to marry a millionaire, but complications ensue.

filmography.title: Pilot #5
filmography.role_description: A fighter pilot who volunteers for a suicide mission, with flashbacks revealing his troubled past.
filmography.plot: As a pilot flies a dangerous mission in the Pacific, his fellow soldiers recall the events that led him to this point.

filmography.title: Here Comes the Groom
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and kind real estate developer who is engaged to the woman Bing Crosby loves.
filmography.plot: A reporter must marry within a week to keep the orphans he adopted, but his fiancée is about to marry a millionaire.

filmography.title: Gabriel Over the White House
filmography.role_description: The secretary to a corrupt President who witnesses his boss's miraculous transformation.
filmography.plot: A corrupt U.S. President suffers a near-fatal car accident and wakes up divinely inspired to end the Great Depression.

filmography.title: Fast and Furious
filmography.role_description: A rare book dealer and amateur detective who investigates a murder at a beauty pageant.
filmography.plot: A book dealer and his wife get involved in a murder mystery while attending a beauty contest.

filmography.title: The Man on the Eiffel Tower
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but psychopathic student who taunts Inspector Maigret in this thriller.
filmography.plot: Inspector Maigret hunts a murderer through the streets of Paris, engaging in a battle of wits with a suspect.

filmography.title: Romance on the High Seas
filmography.role_description: A private detective hired to spy on a woman during a cruise, only to fall in love with her.
filmography.plot: A suspicious husband hires a detective to watch his wife on a cruise, but she sends a singer in her place.

filmography.title: Mickey One
filmography.role_description: The manager of a nightclub who hires a comedian on the run from the mob.
filmography.plot: A comedian flees the mob and tries to restart his life in Chicago, but is haunted by paranoia.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Nomination – Golden Lion

filmography.title: Nice Girl?
filmography.role_description: A handsome New Yorker who captures the attention of a small-town girl.
filmography.plot: A small-town girl tries to liven up her image to attract a visiting scientist.

filmography.title: Love Is a Headache
filmography.role_description: A newspaper columnist whose criticism of an actress leads to a romantic entanglement.
filmography.plot: A publicity stunt involving two orphans backfires for an actress and a columnist.

filmography.title: Moulin Rouge
filmography.role_description: A playwright who is married to a temperamental singer who decides to pose as her own sister.
filmography.plot: A singer poses as her own French sister to re-seduce her husband and test his fidelity.
